Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I haven't been on here for a few months....just been getting on with it. Anyway........I finnished all my treatment i at the end of Feb and 2 weeks ago I  tootled off confidently to have the first of my yearly mamograms.  Sods law.....I am being recalled for a  stereo mammotme biopsy. AND I AM FRIGHTENED! What is the test and why should I need it. Has anyone else had this on here? Can you please reassure me Yeah I know I can speak to my Barts nurse but the support I have had from everyone on this site  gives me confidence . Hugs to all xxx
Posts.Title: Recall after final mamogramme

Posts.Content: Hello people, What a flaming rollercoaster of a day. To cut a long story short..... ....Clear margins......Hoorah, Zero lymph glands affected ......another Hoorah Upgrade from 2 to 3 ....Boo 6 Lots of Chemo....Boo HER2 neg...Not sure weather to boo or hoorah..... advice please. 15 Rads.... Boo. But it could have been so much worse so I am counting my blessings. Do any of you know anything about a trial that I may be offered access to called the OLYMPUS trial. My surgeon said it could be significantly beneficial to me because I have the HER2 Negative so NO Herceptine etc would help. Thanks everyone, onward and upward. Oncologist in two weeks. Anyone able to tell me how much longer after that it may be before chemo starts? Dinner now methinks Hugs one and all xxxxx
Posts.Title: Got my results today....could have been worse!

Posts.Content: Thank you for that, I had a quick look and yes I seem to meet the required criteria. Trust me to get the name wrong....but then it has been one of those days and we all get them.... don't we.? Triple neg wasn't a term that was used today but it seems to fit what I was told. I will have a read tomorrow about what exactly could mean   but for the time being I just want to enjoy the fact that it hasn't spread. I do hope its not too bad! I have knackered veins so will probably need a PICC or port or somesuch. Thank you for being there Hugs to you and the better half xx
Posts.Title: Got my results today....could have been worse!

Posts.Content: Thank you both so much for taking the time to reply to me. So...I am going to get the staff excited am I !! Triple neg eh--thats me.. I am grateful for the description of the practicalities because the last lot of chemo caused osteoporosis  and I have a broken spine so find some procedures extremely difficult.I am also grateful for your best wishes and hugs. Right back at you ladies xxx
Posts.Title: Recall after final mamogramme

Posts.Content: Thank you again Jacqueline I'll do that. Hugs x
Posts.Title: 72 hours since lumpectomy right breast....why does left one hurt?

Posts.Content: Hello I'm back...... Is this normal or should I be ringing someone in the morning. My left nipple feels like a hot needle is being poked into it. Ta very much:-)
Posts.Title: 72 hours since lumpectomy right breast....why does left one hurt?

Posts.Content: Hello all, I'm a new member of the June chemo club and don't officially join until 10.30 tomorrow morning. I have a picc line in and am ready willing and able to kick BCs butt. I also want to join the Neddys;-)) I am scared but wouldn't be normal if I wasn't eh...so wish me well. I have been following all the advice about how to prepare for... and what to take to chemo. Thank you to everyone that contributed to those threads it really has helped me prepare myself. It's also given me a fine excuse to have a bit of a spending spree on..ME....not something that happens that often. Right...got to go and get  dinner ready for visitors this afternoon, Full Roast! Yummy! hugs xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Marcia, just to let you know I will be thinking of you tomorrow. I do hope it all goes well for everyone of us newbies. Hope you enjoyed your dinner, when I'm a neddy I will hold a banquet and any other neddy member should consider themselves invited! And to everyone else that has been SO supportive .....You are amazing. Thank you , thank you, thank you. You help keep me grounded and I am grateful.  BIG HUGS TO ALL, xxxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I have my last  (6th) chemo tomorrow and had my gene result last week. Thank heavens it was negative. However I have tnbc and was offered the chance had my test been positive to go on a new drug trial that my oncologist had told me could be of substantial benefit to me. So guiltily I felt torn. I wanted to have the opportunity to try a drug that could be instrumental in preventing re-occurance but I desperately did not want to pass on the dreaded gene to my wonderful children and grandchildren. On balance I am so glad that it was negative. We all have our own reasons for taking this test and NO ONE has a right to judge you until they have walked in your shoes. Tell the Naysayers to get lost and enjoy the positivity and support of the new friends you will find on this fabulous site. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Been a while again but on 6th and final chemo

Posts.Content: You lot are absolutely inspirational.  Sorry about the circumstances but so glad I met ya ! Thank you all, I will try to chose better jokes in future xxxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done...Hoorah...Onward and upward ;-)

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, A bit sore and a bit black and blue but relieved to have begun the process finally.So .....  now for the 2 week wait before finding out what next , but at least the treatment has started, so a huge step forward. I was told because it was a large lump that It will probably be Rads, Chemo and Herceptine. Whatever it takes eh people. Thank you for all the Birthday wishes......it was a bit of a weird one this year but next year is going to be a doozy! Hugs xx Ps (Daft  joke)  I went to a zoo the other day and they only had one dog there...I think it was a shitzoo !!!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done...Hoorah...Onward and upward ;-)

Posts.Content: Thank you Jannie 13, You have expressed my feelings perfectly, I don't believe the fundraisers have understood at all. I am also grateful for Macmillans but I wish  they would please stop upsetting me and mine ! Hugs to all. xxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: And I might even learn to spell!!!!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done...Hoorah...Onward and upward ;-)

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, It has been a while since I have been on here, but like a lot of you I feel so profoundly fed up with Macmillan aparantly not giving a toss about how thier advertising affects those of us and our famillies that are dealing with cancer everyday. Why don't they recognise  the emotional stress that pervades our homes. I could be quite happily playing with my granddaughter and then one of those insensative or depressing or just plain distressing ads pops up. Why don't they consult us .....before first broadcasting these things?. OH it makes me so damn mad! Hugs to all
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hello cycling-girl, Thank you for your advice, I don't know stage or grade yet but I will certainly do as much research as possible so I can make an informed decision. "You will now be treated to recovery"...what a wonderfully uplifting sentence....thank you thank you.! I wish you all the things you would wish for yourself Goodnight
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Having just been diagnosed with breast cancer this week I really need to read something positive and hopeful. Also something for my family to read perhaps. I think I feel worse for them than I do for me suggestions please?  I have an appointment on Friday to discuss treatment options and am frightened...... but then at least now it has been diagnosed it can be treated eh!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Cheers Emma, I will certainly do that. Thank you for replying so quickly...nice surprise! Goodnight,
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Oh your family sounds like mine....I have 3 grandchildren and can imagine my youngest doing exactly that. I look forward to the day when it is my turn ! I am sorry  you feel alone, I have read that it can be hard to move on once you have been discharged but take comfort in that you now have the TIME to adjust. HOORAH! Thanks for replying so quickly, Maybe I will be able to stay sane after all. Luck and love to you too
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Thank you Mike...I am so happy for you...what a wonderful post. All my best wishes
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone, I was hoping to reply to each wonderful new friend individually but I have been overwhelmed by the outpouring of support that the last 24 hours has brought me. Thank you Thank you Thank you. Every single post has given me a reason to lift the spirit and I know without a shadow of a doubt that if positivity can help you through this then I will be just dandy! What an amazing bunch of people!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My family are being great and unlikely as this seems we also have  a Wales/England connection. Suffice to say that although I am a Londoner my son in law is a Valley boy through and through and I lived in Ystrad Mynach for a while. Granddaughter born in London....Grandson born in Cardiff. Small world isn't it? Talk to you all tomorrow, Nos Da
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Hi Allme, Thank you for replying so quickly, I have a feeling that this site will become a lifeline to my sanity so thank you for helping to kickstart the process. My best wishes
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Oh Birty, Just the fact that you have taken the time to reply to my post on such an important day  humbles me. THANK YOU....you have helped me more than you could possibly know. I may sleep tonight now, please stay in touch and let me know how your recovery goes. I hope you sleep too xx All my best
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Blo*dy Heck.......just the fact that you have members of TWENTY years standing is inspiring. I hope that as I recover I can find a suitable support group and that you have great success with yours. Hugsxx
Posts.Title: survivorship

Posts.Content: Thrilled for both of you. Enjoy your celebrations ladies :-)) Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Sorry I didn't get back to you sooner....long story....another day! I live in east London and although my local hospital is Whipps Cross I have been having all my appointments at Barts. So tomorrow is the big day, I hope you sleep tonight, wake refreshed and that the next steps along your path to health are not too traumatic. Luv and all my best- best wishes to you. xxxxx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Just to say I will be thinking of you tomorrow Ali. London is very wet and grey too, but at least it smells clean! Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Silly Cow! (her not you)They say it takes all sorts to make a world but comments like that make me think there are some sorts we could definitely do without. Good job you can be magnanimous INNIT EH !! Hugs x
Posts.Title: stupid comments part 1!!!!!

Posts.Content: I am so happy for you, congratulations! Cheers
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Thank you all so much for all your kind words and support. I luv you all! BIG HUGS Wendy xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: RIP Cancer 12/04/15---11/02/16 I'm there! LAST TREATMENT TODAY, No...

Posts.Content: Hi there Mlanders. I'm exactly where you are, waiting for results on Friday too. I have been coming on here since the day I was diagnosed (7-4-15) so oh boy do I feel ready to hear those results. Everyone without exception has said that the waiting is the worst part and once they know what the plan is it seems that you settle into  a new kind of normal.... a kind of stable routine, at least for a few months. The support of the people on this forum has been a lifesaver for me. They have never laughed at my daft questions (evidently there is no such thing as a daft question!) just given me straightforward sensible and honest advice.  I have been informed ,nurtured, entertained and generally kept sane by people that really understand what we are experiencing. Best advice so far.....Don't Google...use baby wipes under arms......take the painkillers BEFORE you need them......Do the exercises in the book, have at least three laughs a day:-) Please stay in touch so we can compare notes, Hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!

Posts.Content: As with you Mlanders  I have to have the 15 Rads Also I have been well prepared by my BCN for the likely news that I may need Chemo and Herceptine. I have been reading some of the back threads about what helps and what doesn't help.... and the tips are invaluable. Stuff like  "use plastic cutlery "cos it stops the metallic taste in the food" and you may not feel half as wiped out by Rads as you may be expecting. I have a burning pain at the back of my armpit which is a real  So & So as well as all the normal numbness where the nerves were damaged and the soreness and bruising that comes with any surgery trauma. (Yep.. I've had a lot of ops over the years!) I am sticking to the excercises though because I can hardly move my arm first thing in the morning but it gets easier throughout the day. What about you.....any of this sounding familiar? Stroll on Friday eh!  Heres hoping for better than expected news. Hugs x
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!

Posts.Content: Hi there AliG, Thank you, Indeed I do see it as a fabulous prezzy, I really wasn't being ironic in my first post. Maybe it isn't the present I would have chosen last year but this year it is a whole different ball game. Vegas eh.........WOW....... and skydiving. Love your attitude, let me know how the savings get on, Hugs x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Hi Hevbojangles, here's to birthdays we will never forget::) I know it is a cliché........., but that day will be the first day of the rest of our lives....and without the intruders! The gift of health  , what more could we ask for! I wish for you all that you would wish for yourself, Hugs x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Hi Hevbojangles, here's to birthdays we will never forget::) I know it is a cliché........., but that day will be the first day of the rest of our lives....and without the intruders! The gift of health  , what more could we ask for! I wish for you all that you would wish for yourself, Hugs x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: I saw the surgeon today and would you believe it...the first date available for the op is my 59th birthday! Well I presume I wont be up to a party but what a prezzy! 3 Weeks of radiotherapy and it is looking increasingly likely that I will be on Herceptin and chemo, but no confirmation until yet more tests come back from the lab as at the moment I am designated borderline...duh...something (can't at this moment remember what). OH IT HAS BEEN A LONG DAY. I feel a little overwhelmed by all the information and the terminology used today. Maybe after a sleep I will have my head on straight again eh! I am not quite so scared now that I have practical things to deal with and I have read to so many positive posts. I am not kidding myself at all..... but so many people use the word "Do-able" that I know I can and will get through this successfully. Thanks for listening to me ramble Hugs to all
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Oh AliG..., I am so sorry that you didn't get the news you hoped for. However you are a strong amazing woman and even if this knocks you back for a while..... (you are entitled).....then I am sure with the help of your sis and friends you will be able to focus on your skydive in Vegas at the end of this blo*dy long tunnel. You don't need two boobs for that ya knows! Now if you do feel the need to virtually slap any impertinence , call on me and I will hold em down for you. All my very best wishes to you and HUGS x
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: I saw the surgeon today and would you believe it...the first date available for the op is my 59th birthday! Well I presume I wont be up to a party but what a prezzy! 3 Weeks of radiotherapy and it is looking increasingly likely that I will be on Herceptin and chemo, but no confirmation until yet more tests come back from the lab as at the moment I am designated borderline...duh...something (can't at this moment remember what). Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Oh you lovely lot.....I am so glad I found You. The way I look at it is that hopefully the day after my op I will be clear of cancer...... and all the rest is to prevent the damn thing coming back! I also have lost family to this but that doesn't mean it's getting me! My 60th birthday will I promise you be a day to remember  In fact I may start planning it now. What do think ....maybe hang gliding is out of the question but I would like to do something a little off the wall (well for a larger more mature lady like me). All suggestions welcome I'm off to plant cuttings in my garden now....this time next year they should have turned into large healthy shrubs, I look forward to watching them grow. Hugs too x

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday.Dragonlady.:) .I've decided to have my birthday a couple of days early this time so I don't miss out too much...and maybe even celebrate after the op as well. Maybe I am just secretly greedy eh! I'm glad you had a lovely time All my best
